name: SketchUp Style
summary: Learn about .STYLE files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: @Last Software initially developed SketchUp and released it in 2000. Then, Google acquired @Last Software in 2006 and developed SketchUp until 2012, when Trimble purchased the software.
Before SketchUp Pro (version 6), the Style Builder was separate from SketchUp. However, since version 6, the Style Builder is included with SketchUp Pro.

You can access styles in the Styles panel in the Default Tray. After selecting the style, you can apply it to your drawings to give them a specific appearance (like a hand-drawn aesthetic) and make them look uniform.
To share a style with another SketchUp user:
Choose In Model in the Styles Collections dropdown list.
Right-click the style you would like to share and select Save As.

instructions: You can open a STYLE file with Trimble SketchUp in Windows and macOS. For example to open a STYLE file a user shared with you:
Click the Details arrow in the Select tab and choose Open an Existing Collection.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
